meanings.definition: of or relating to a larva
meanings.sent1: The larval stage of the butterfly is when it is a caterpillar.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the larval development of the tadpoles.
meanings.sent3: The larval creatures in the pond were having a race to see who could swim the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was in a larval state, waiting to blossom into something beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The larval characteristics of the baby bird were evident in its behavior.

meanings.definition: in the form of a larva
meanings.sent1: The larval insect crawled slowly across the leaf.
meanings.sent2: The larval fish had not yet developed its full coloring.
meanings.sent3: The larval costume at the party was a big hit, everyone loved it.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were still larval, not fully formed but full of potential.
meanings.sent5: The larval appearance of the creature made it hard to identify.

meanings.sent1: The larval markings on the snake made it look dangerous.
meanings.sent2: The larval cloud in the sky signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The larval drawing on the wall was so realistic, it seemed alive.
meanings.sent4: His larval behavior in the meeting annoyed his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The larval sound of the engine indicated a problem.
